page.title: 18GARFORTH RAILWAY STATION
page.content: {Garforth Railway Station}was opened in l834 on the N.E.R. line and was chiefly used as a{goods station.}In l96O the goods warehouse and weigh office were demolished. The signal box was closed and the sidings removed in l985, although the footbridge built in l9O9 is still in use. Today Garforth is used solely as a{passenger station. Normally 5OO passengers each day use some of the 63 trains which pass through, usually travelling to Leeds, York and Selby or the smaller stations between. About 3OO tickets a day are sold. Some passengers have season tickets. They travel to work, to shop and for entertainment in the larger towns. There are also through trains to Hull, Newcastle and Liverpool. There are three members of{British {Rail Staff}working at Garforth. Best kept station awards have been won.
